title: Save Big On Xbox Game Pass Ultimate Ahead Of Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6's Friday Launch
description: Xbox Game Pass Ultimate 3-Month Prepaid Code Save big at Woot: $36.49 | Compared to: $50 on Amazon, $60 on Xbox Store See at Woot See at Amazon 3-Month PC Game Pass Subscription $30 | Save $6 compared to Microsoft's monthly price See at Amazon Once again, Amazon-owned retailer Woot has a stellar deal on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions, just in time for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's October 25 launch. Until the end of the month while supplies last, you can snag 3-Month Xbox Game Pass Ultimate codes for only $36.49 and 1-Month codes for $13.79. You'd spend $60 for three months directly from the Xbox Store or $50 for a prepaid code at major retailers, so you're saving anywhere from $13.50 to $23.48, depending on how you normally pay for Game Pass Ultimate. See at Woot Black Ops 6 will be added to the Game Pass Ultimate library on launch day. Subscribers can play the new FPS on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, and Xbox Cloud Gaming without needing to buy a copy of the game.If you've never shopped at Woot, you can sign in using your Amazon account. When placing your order, you will need to input your shipping address, but the codes will be delivered to your email. Woot sends a shipping confirmation email with a "tracking number" shortly after your order is finalized. The tracking number is actually the 25-character key that you need to redeem on the Xbox Store.Continue Reading at GameSpot
excerpt: Ahead of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's October 25 launch, you can save big on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate at Woot.
text: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links. Once again, Amazon-owned retailer Woot has a stellar deal on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions, just in time for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's October 25 launch. Until the end of the month while supplies last, you can snag 3-Month Xbox Game Pass Ultimate codes for only $36.49 and 1-Month codes for $13.79. You'd spend $60 for three months directly from the Xbox Store or $50 for a prepaid code at major retailers, so you're saving anywhere from $13.50 to $23.48, depending on how you normally pay for Game Pass Ultimate.Black Ops 6 will be added to the Game Pass Ultimate library on launch day. Subscribers can play the new FPS on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, and Xbox Cloud Gaming without needing to buy a copy of the game.If you've never shopped at Woot, you can sign in using your Amazon account. When placing your order, you will need to input your shipping address, but the codes will be delivered to your email. Woot sends a shipping confirmation email with a "tracking number" shortly after your order is finalized. The tracking number is actually the 25-character key that you need to redeem on the Xbox Store.Xbox Game Pass Ultimate is stackable up to 36 months, so you could buy up to 12 codes and redeem all of them today if you aren't a current member. These codes are redeemable for both new and active subscribers. If you are charged monthly by the Xbox Store, redeeming a prepaid code will automatically push your next billing date to the day after your prepaid voucher time ends.Buying three months of Game Pass Ultimate from Woot drops your monthly cost to $12.16, a nearly $8 discount versus the Xbox Store. It's also $4.50 less than the monthly average when buying the $50 three-month vouchers from major retailers. If you purchase four vouchers from Woot at $36.49 each, your annual Game Pass Ultimate cost is only $146--a steep reduction from the $240 cost from the Xbox Store and the $200 cost from prepaid vouchers at Amazon.Game Pass Ultimate costs $20/month when you subscribe directly on the Xbox Store. Even if Woot's deal sells out--and these Game Pass offers frequently do--you'll still want to opt for the prepaid voucher method for the time being. Microsoft raised the price of Game Pass Ultimate from $17 to $20 last month, but major retailers are still selling codes at the old prices: $50 for three months and $17 for one month. Amazon had three-month vouchers for $45 up until this week--the retailer finally joined other retailers at the $50 price point. But since it costs $60 across three months directly from Xbox, the $50 offer is still a smart way to subscribe. Amazon may have raised the price of three-month codes to $50, but the retailer still has a fantastic Game Pass-related deal right now. You can get a brand-new Xbox Wireless Controller, an Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K, and one month of Game Pass Ultimate for $75. This bundle is valued at up to $137, as Xbox Wireless Controllers retail for $60-$70, the Fire TV Stick 4K is $50, and Game Pass Ultimate is $17. A handful of controller color options are available, including the recently released transparent blue Sky Cipher Special Edition. Alternatively, you can get the same bundle with the Fire TV Stick 4K Max ($60 value) for $80.Xbox Cloud Gaming was added to Fire TV 4K streaming devices over the summer, so you can stream hundreds of Game Pass games on your Fire Stick, including Call of Duty: Black Ops 6. Xbox Cloud Gaming is only included with the Ultimate tier of Game Pass. If you need a new Xbox controller and have use for the Fire Stick--for game streaming or not--these bundles offer terrific value. Check out our full breakdown of Amazon's Xbox Cloud Gaming starter kit for more details--it's unclear when the promotion expires. html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Once again, Amazon-owned retailer Woot has a stellar deal on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions, just in time for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's October 25 launch. Until the end of the month while supplies last, you can snag 3-Month Xbox Game Pass Ultimate codes for only $36.49 and 1-Month codes for $13.79. You'd spend $60 for three months directly from the Xbox Store or $50 for a prepaid code at major retailers, so you're saving anywhere from $13.50 to $23.48, depending on how you normally pay for Game Pass Ultimate.

Black Ops 6 will be added to the Game Pass Ultimate library on launch day. Subscribers can play the new FPS on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, and Xbox Cloud Gaming without needing to buy a copy of the game.

If you've never shopped at Woot, you can sign in using your Amazon account. When placing your order, you will need to input your shipping address, but the codes will be delivered to your email. Woot sends a shipping confirmation email with a "tracking number" shortly after your order is finalized. The tracking number is actually the 25-character key that you need to redeem on the Xbox Store.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate is stackable up to 36 months, so you could buy up to 12 codes and redeem all of them today if you aren't a current member. These codes are redeemable for both new and active subscribers. If you are charged monthly by the Xbox Store, redeeming a prepaid code will automatically push your next billing date to the day after your prepaid voucher time ends.

Buying three months of Game Pass Ultimate from Woot drops your monthly cost to $12.16, a nearly $8 discount versus the Xbox Store. It's also $4.50 less than the monthly average when buying the $50 three-month vouchers from major retailers. If you purchase four vouchers from Woot at $36.49 each, your annual Game Pass Ultimate cost is only $146--a steep reduction from the $240 cost from the Xbox Store and the $200 cost from prepaid vouchers at Amazon.

Game Pass Ultimate costs $20/month when you subscribe directly on the Xbox Store. Even if Woot's deal sells out--and these Game Pass offers frequently do--you'll still want to opt for the prepaid voucher method for the time being. Microsoft raised the price of Game Pass Ultimate from $17 to $20 last month, but major retailers are still selling codes at the old prices: $50 for three months and $17 for one month. Amazon had three-month vouchers for $45 up until this week--the retailer finally joined other retailers at the $50 price point. But since it costs $60 across three months directly from Xbox, the $50 offer is still a smart way to subscribe.

Amazon may have raised the price of three-month codes to $50, but the retailer still has a fantastic Game Pass-related deal right now. You can get a brand-new Xbox Wireless Controller, an Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K, and one month of Game Pass Ultimate for $75. This bundle is valued at up to $137, as Xbox Wireless Controllers retail for $60-$70, the Fire TV Stick 4K is $50, and Game Pass Ultimate is $17. A handful of controller color options are available, including the recently released transparent blue Sky Cipher Special Edition. Alternatively, you can get the same bundle with the Fire TV Stick 4K Max ($60 value) for $80.

Xbox Cloud Gaming was added to Fire TV 4K streaming devices over the summer, so you can stream hundreds of Game Pass games on your Fire Stick, including Call of Duty: Black Ops 6. Xbox Cloud Gaming is only included with the Ultimate tier of Game Pass. If you need a new Xbox controller and have use for the Fire Stick--for game streaming or not--these bundles offer terrific value. Check out our full breakdown of Amazon's Xbox Cloud Gaming starter kit for more details--it's unclear when the promotion expires.
